Plot heatmap for quadrant-classified features

plot_heatmap_quadrants.Rd

Generates a standardized heatmap of feature expression grouped by quadrant (Q1–Q4) and sample group (e.g., HC / Pre / Post). Quadrants are optionally filtered by delta cutoff thresholds.

Usage

plot_heatmap_quadrants(
  X,
  group,
  df_quad,
  cutoff = 0.15,
  palette_group = NULL,
  palette_quad = NULL,
  scale = TRUE,
  cap = 2,
  show_rownames = TRUE,
  show_colnames = TRUE,
  cluster_rows = FALSE,
  cluster_cols = FALSE
)

Arguments

X

numeric matrix features x samples; expression matrix.

group

factor/character of length = ncol(X); sample group labels.

df_quad

data.frame with columns: feature, quadrant, and delta.

cutoff

numeric; delta threshold for selecting strong quadrant features (default 0.15). Quadrants Q1 and Q4 use delta > cutoff; Q2 and Q3 use delta < -cutoff.

palette_group

optional named color vector for sample groups.

palette_quad

optional named color vector for quadrants.

scale

logical; z-score features (default TRUE).

cap

numeric; cap scaled values at ±cap (default 2).

show_rownames, show_colnames

logical; show labels (default TRUE).

cluster_rows, cluster_cols

logical; cluster rows/columns (default FALSE).

width, height

numeric; optional dimensions for PDF export.

Value

Invisibly returns the pheatmap object.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
plot_heatmap_quadrants_auto(
  X = crc.imputed,
  group = group,
  df_quad = df,
  cutoff = 0.15
)
} # }
